---
title: "Installation"
description: "Install and configure Janus Python SDK for AI agent testing"
---

## Installation Guide

Get Janus Python SDK up and running in your environment.

## Requirements

<Check>
- **Python**: 3.9 or higher
- **pip**: Latest version recommended
- **API Key**: Janus API key (contact [team@withjanus.com](mailto:team@withjanus.com))
</Check>

## Install with pip

The recommended way to install Janus Python SDK is using pip:

```bash
pip install janus-python-sdk
```

<Info>
This will install the latest stable version of the SDK along with all required dependencies.
</Info>



## Verify Installation

Test that the SDK is installed correctly:

```python
import janus_sdk
print(f"Janus SDK version: {janus_sdk.__version__}")
```

<Check>
If you see the version number, the installation was successful!
</Check>

## Dependencies

Janus Python SDK automatically installs these dependencies:

<CodeGroup>
```bash Core Dependencies
httpx>=0.23,<1.0
openai>=1.0
python-dotenv>=1.0
rich>=13.0,<14.0
tiktoken>=0.5.1
```

```bash Tracing Dependencies
opentelemetry-api>=1.20.0
opentelemetry-sdk>=1.20.0
opentelemetry-exporter-otlp-proto-http>=1.20.0
```
</CodeGroup>

<Note>
All dependencies are automatically managed by pip. You don't need to install them separately.
</Note>

## Environment Setup

### 1. Get Your API Key

Contact the Janus team at [team@withjanus.com](mailto:team@withjanus.com) to get your API key and login credentials.

### 2. Create Environment File

Create a `.env` file in your project root:

```bash
# .env
JANUS_API_KEY=your_janus_api_key_here
OPENAI_API_KEY=your_openai_api_key_here  # If using OpenAI models
```

### 3. Load Environment Variables

Use python-dotenv to load your environment variables:

```python
from dotenv import load_dotenv
import os

load_dotenv()
api_key = os.getenv("JANUS_API_KEY")
```

<Warning>
Never commit your `.env` file to version control. Add it to your `.gitignore` file.
</Warning>
